DOC.brief_summary: The aim pilot study determine effect physiotherapy impairment health-related quality life people painful osteoporotic spinal fracture . It hypothesise physiotherapy reduce impairment improve quality life patient group .
DOC.criteria: female , least five year postmenopause age > 50 year primary osteoporosis define DXA T score < 2.5 either spine proximal femur least one morphometric vertebral crush fracture sustain 3 month 2 year previously back pain/discomfort thoracic lumbar region felt least weekly within last 6 month stable dose medication treatment osteoporosis ( eg . hormone replacement therapy , bisphosphonates ) community dwell able attend treatment English speaking secondary cause bone loss osteomalacia , glucocorticoid medication etc . comorbidities would interfere participation exercise severe heart pulmonary disease , inflammatory joint disease , severe osteoarthritis , psychiatric condition acute vertebral fracture past 3 month sign symptom arise nerve root compression back pain radiate low limb previous participation formal pain management program back pain physiotherapy back pain past 6 month allergic reaction adhesive tape poor skin condition would prevent use tape
